Text: Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil, but those who plan peace have joy.

Questions: Where did Paul leave the sick Trophimus?
Text: Erastus remained at Corinth, and I left Trophimus, who was ill, at Miletus.

Questions: In a battle against the Syrians what killed 27000 of them in the city of Aphek?
Text: And the rest fled into the city of Aphek, and the wall fell upon 27,000 men who were left. Ben-hadad also fled and entered an inner chamber in the city.

Questions: What weight of gold was Solomon recorded as acquiring in one year?
Text: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was 666 talents of gold,

Questions: Who addresses an epistle to the "twelve tribes which are scattered abroad"?
Text: James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ,To the twelve tribes in the Dispersion:Greetings.

Questions: Who was killed by a wet blanket?
Text: But the next day he took the bed cloth and dipped it in water and spread it over his face, till he died. And Hazael became king in his place.

Questions: In the parable of the Prodigal Son what did the son do after he received the inheritance?
Text: Not many days later, the younger son gathered all he had and took a journey into a far country, and there he squandered his property in reckless living.

Questions: What did Elisha throw into Jericho's water supply to "heal" it?
Text: Then he went to the spring of water and threw salt in it and said, "Thus says the LORD, I have healed this water; from now on neither death nor miscarriage shall come from it."

Questions: With what unusual weapon did Shamgar slay 600 Philistines?
Text: After him was Shamgar the son of Anath, who killed 600 of the Philistines with an oxgoad, and he also saved Israel.

Questions: In which tribe was the city of Ramoth-Gilead?
Text: Bezer in the wilderness on the tableland for the Reubenites, Ramoth in Gilead for the Gadites, and Golan in Bashan for the Manassites.

Questions: Why do the four and twenty elders in Revelation give thanks to God?
Answers: God has taken his power and commenced his reign
Text: saying, "We give thanks to you, Lord God Almighty, who is and who was, for you have taken your great power and begun to reign.

Questions: David refers to the tribe of Judah as his what in the Psalms?
Text: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.

Questions: When Isaiah describes the desolation of the last days a man shall "cast his idols of silver and his idols of gold to the moles" and the what?
Text: In that day mankind will cast away their idols of silver and their idols of gold, which they made for themselves to worship, to the moles and to the bats,

Questions: Children in the region of what age were to be killed in the hope that the young Jesus would also be killed?
Text: Then Herod, when he saw that he had been tricked by the wise men, became furious, and he sent and killed all the male children in Bethlehem and in all that region who were two years old or under, according to the time that he had ascertained from the wise men.

Questions: Where was Solomon anointed?
Text: So Zadok the priest, Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites went down and had Solomon ride on King David's mule and brought him to Gihon.

Questions: Christ was led away to which high priest first?
Text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John the son of Zechariah in the wilderness.

Questions: Whose mother does Paul greet in the letter to the Romans?
Text: Greet Rufus, chosen in the Lord; also his mother, who has been a mother to me as well.

Questions: "The legs of the lame hanging limp" are like what in the mouth of fools?
Text: Like a lame man's legs, which hang useless, is a proverb in the mouth of fools.

Questions: How does Peter say a husband should treat his wife?
Text: Likewise, husbands, live with your wives in an understanding way, showing honor to the woman as the weaker vessel, since they are heirs with you of the grace of life, so that your prayers may not be hindered.

Questions: Why does David say "the daughters of Judah should be glad"?
Answers: Because of the judgments of the Lord
Text: Let Mount Zion be glad! Let the daughters of Judah rejoice because of your judgments!

Questions: For how many shekels of silver did Abraham purchase the field of Machpelah?
Text: Abraham listened to Ephron, and Abraham weighed out for Ephron the silver that he had named in the hearing of the Hittites, four hundred shekels of silver, according to the weights current among the merchants.

Questions: In Ezekiel's prophecy who is said to be the "mother of Jerusalem"?
Text: and say, Thus says the Lord GOD to Jerusalem:Your origin and your birth are of the land of the Canaanites; your father was an Amorite and your mother a Hittite.

Questions: Who asked Jesus what is the greatest commandment of all?
Text: And one of the scribes came up and heard them disputing with one another, and seeing that he answered them well, asked him, "Which commandment is the most important of all?"

Questions: Who succeeded Herod the Great after his death?
Text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in place of his father Herod, he was afraid to go there, and being warned in a dream he withdrew to the district of Galilee.

Questions: On Paul's journey to Rome at what location did he meet brethren whom he thanked God for?
Text: And the brothers there, when they heard about us, came as far as the Forum of Appius and Three Taverns to meet us. On seeing them, Paul thanked God and took courage.

Questions: Proverbs describes a "fair woman without discretion" as like a jewel of gold in what?
Text: Like a gold ring in a pig's snout is a beautiful woman without discretion.

Questions: Who was the firstborn of David?
Text: These are the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron:the firstborn, Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelite; the second, Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelite,

Questions: In Luke's account of the Sermon on the Mount to who does Jesus say "God is kind"?
Text: But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return, and your reward will be great, and you will be sons of the Most High, for he is kind to the ungrateful and the evil.

Questions: How many cities did the Levites possess?
Text: The cities of the Levites in the midst of the possession of the people of Israel were in all forty-eight cities with their pasturelands.
